numbered_ace_sentences: 1. I notice a large division line in the graph.
2. The division line separates the percentage of 15-24-year-olds from the percentage of people who are 40 years old or older.
3. The graph shows the percentage of people who say that the world is getting better with each generation.
4. There is a stark contrast between these generations.
5. This contrast shows a difference in optimism between the generations.
6. The survey includes about 1000 people from each listed country.
7. I wonder how accurate this graph is.
8. Each country has millions of people.
9. The survey uses about 1000 people to represent each country.
10. Therefore the margin of error may be large.
11. I wonder how strong the generational effect is.
12. The graph suggests that older people have less optimism.
13. I wonder why many 15-24-year-olds are hopeless about future generations.
14. I am in the 15-24-year-old category.
15. I am a member of Generation Z.
16. This graph relates to me and my community.
17. If someone asked me the same question, I would likely say that the world is not getting better with each generation.
18. I have learned certain things over the years.
19. I do not think that the world has gotten worse with each generation.
20. I think that the world is almost the same with each generation.
21. The headline is: Gen Z: The Hopeful or Hopeless?
